intro: Cryptocentrum lehmannii, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
